post.title: There is a new World Height Limit in Minecraft (1.17 Caves Update)

body: Cubic completely nukes compatibility with like 99% of mods though so if they just yoinked Cubic and integrated it into the game mods would be dead for a good while, and they don't really want to kill off mods which is actually why don't have an official modding API.
body_html: Cubic completely nukes compatibility with like 99% of mods though so if they just yoinked Cubic and integrated it into the game mods would be dead for a good while, and they don't really want to kill off mods which is actually why don't have an official modding API.

body: Mods are still stuck on 1.7.10 anyway because the code just got so bloated after that. They made all sorts of changes that don't do anything but make it harder to run, like having a whole class for every single position instead of just 3 simple ints. And it also broke mods, so that's why a lot haven't updated.
body_html: Mods are still stuck on 1.7.10 anyway because the code just got so bloated after that. They made all sorts of changes that don't do anything but make it harder to run, like having a whole class for every single position instead of just 3 simple ints. And it also broke mods, so that's why a lot haven't updated.

body: Creative mode and the new blocks, probably the endermen, more biomes (but with the old generator), new ores and gems and maybe the dragon, but no end and it shouldn't be hostile or destroy blocks. Possibly villages but with no trades. Definitely not hunger or any of the overhauled mechanics. Horses probably. Nothing like mineshafts or temples or anything like that, definitely not woodland mansions. Basically keep it the same simple building game. Nothing that mods the vanilla experience, just some new additions. The new textures are too consistent and mess with its charm too.
body_html: Creative mode and the new blocks, probably the endermen, more biomes (but with the old generator), new ores and gems and maybe the dragon, but no end and it shouldn't be hostile or destroy blocks. Possibly villages but with no trades. Definitely not hunger or any of the overhauled mechanics. Horses probably. Nothing like mineshafts or temples or anything like that, definitely not woodland mansions. Basically keep it the same simple building game. Nothing that mods the vanilla experience, just some new additions. The new textures are too consistent and mess with its charm too.

post.title: There is a new World Height Limit in Minecraft (1.17 Caves Update)

body: Stuck on 1.7.10 what? All the usual suspects have made jumps to 1.12.x at least. Mekanism, Twilight Forest, Galacticraft, Abyssalcraft,  AE2, Draconic Evolution, etc etc and in fact a lot of them don't even update their 1.7.10 branches anymore.
body_html: Stuck on 1.7.10 what? All the usual suspects have made jumps to 1.12.x at least. Mekanism, Twilight Forest, Galacticraft, Abyssalcraft, AE2, Draconic Evolution, etc etc and in fact a lot of them don't even update their 1.7.10 branches anymore.

parent.body: Mods are still stuck on 1.7.10 anyway because the code just got so bloated after that. They made all sorts of changes that don't do anything but make it harder to run, like having a whole class for every single position instead of just 3 simple ints. And it also broke mods, so that's why a lot haven't updated.
parent.body_html: Mods are still stuck on 1.7.10 anyway because the code just got so bloated after that. They made all sorts of changes that don't do anything but make it harder to run, like having a whole class for every single position instead of just 3 simple ints. And it also broke mods, so that's why a lot haven't updated.
